detaileddescription.para: Rationales: SoMgr component is intended to provide a easier way to control the sockets and their data buffers. Because of limited memory resources, SoMgr needs to provide the means to allocate and deallocate memory from a fixed length memory area, so the sockets will use the allocate/deallocate functionality to store the received/transmitted data.
Alternatives: Socket Manager is intended as a replacement of SoAd BSW module, as they require a lot of memory and some sort of dynamically memory handling.
Constraints: The integration of SoMgr in the Tcp/Ip context uses the interfaces described in Internal Component Design.
